In Splatoon 2, the Custom Explosher is nearly identical in appearance to the Explosher. The only difference between the two is that the Custom Explosher has a sticker bearing the Custom logo on its side.

In Splatoon 3, the Custom sticker is still present, but the color of the weapon is beige instead of olive green.

The Custom Explosher was announced on 24 November 2018. It was added to the game on 5 December 2018 as part of the version 4.3.0 release.[1]

- The Custom Explosher is a heavyweight weapon.

- The matchmaking range is 207. The game's matchmaking system looks at a team's average matchmaking range value, and matches them against a team with a similar average.

- The ink consumption of 11.7% allows players to attack 8 times before needing to refill the ink supply.
This stat can be changed with Ink Saver (Main).

- This stat can be changed with Ink Saver (Main).

- When initially attacking in humanoid form, the first shot takes 16 frames to come out.

- When attacking from swim form, the first shot takes 22 frames to come out.

- The interval between firing and when the player is able to enter swim form or use a sub weapon is 35 frames.

- The interval at which the player can repeatedly swing is 55 frames.
While this is the number displayed in the game's internal parameter files, actual fire rate may vary by differing amounts depending on the slosher type.

- While this is the number displayed in the game's internal parameter files, actual fire rate may vary by differing amounts depending on the slosher type.

- When attacking while moving, the player's movement speed is set to 0.45 units per frame.

- After firing, there is a 70 frame cooldown before the ink tank starts refilling.

- Attacks will pierce through opponents.

- The maximum damage of direct hits is 55.

- The minimum damage of direct hits is 55.

- Projectiles from the Custom Explosher will explode when they collide with the environment.

- This stat can be changed with Ink Saver (Main).

- While this is the number displayed in the game's internal parameter files, actual fire rate may vary by differing amounts depending on the slosher type.

- The explosion damage is 35.

- The explosion damage radius is 28 units.

- The explosion knockback radius is 50 units.

- The collision radius of direct hits against the environment is 2.5 units.

- The collision radius of direct hits against players is 4 units.

- Projectiles travel straight for 8 frames.

- The draw radius of direct hits is 7 units.

- The paint radius of direct hits scales from 19 units at a distance of 50 units to 19 units at a distance of 150 units.

- All other paint splashes have a radius of 13 units.

- ▼ Points to fill special gauge: 190 → 200.

- ▼ Increased ink consumption by roughly 30%: 9% → 11.7%.

- ▼ Decreased radius of splash damage explosion by roughly 7%: 30 units → 28 units.

- ▼ Decreased the maximum radius of ink coverage for shots fired from beyond a certain distance by roughly 9%, with the amount depending on the distance.
This change won't apply to shots fired from flat ground that travel the maximum distance, but will apply to long-range shots fired to an area of higher or lower elevation.

- This change won't apply to shots fired from flat ground that travel the maximum distance, but will apply to long-range shots fired to an area of higher or lower elevation.

The Custom Explosher is built with custom-tooled parts to create a cool new take on the original! It works like the standard model but comes with a Point Sensor for tracking down foes. And if your opponents are closing in, pop your Baller special and roll out the welcome mat! Are you the type who's eager to greet opponents near or far with inky hospitality? Then give this set a try!

- An Inkling holding the Custom Explosher during the Family vs. Friends Splatfest.

The Custom Explosher returns in Splatoon 3 with a new design and beige color. The weapon was added in the Fresh Season 2024 update. Its kit comes with Splash Walls and the Triple Splashdown.

- The Custom Explosher is a heavyweight weapon.

- The matchmaking range is 20.7. The game's matchmaking system looks at a team's average matchmaking range value, and matches them against a team with a similar average.

- The ink consumption of 11.7% per shot allows the user to fire 8 times on a full ink tank.

- After firing, there is a 70 frame cooldown before ink starts refilling.

- When initially attacking in humanoid form, the first shot takes 16 frames to come out.

- When initially attacking from swim form, the first shot takes 22 frames to come out.

- The movement speed while firing is set to 0.045 units per frame.

- The time between consecutive swings is 55 frames.

- The interval between firing and being able to enter swim form or use a sub weapon is 35 frames.

- The explosion created when the projectile hits the ground deals 35 damage in a radius of 2.8 units.

- The paint created by the blast has a radius of 4.5 units if it lands within 21.0 units of its spawning location. Beyond this, the painting radius is reduced until it reaches a radius of 4.095 units after a travel distance of 23.0 units, and will not have its painting radius reduced further.

- The effective range is about 19.15 units while grounded and 18.87 while airborne.
This is the distance in which the crosshair will change shape when looking at an opponent and is otherwise arbitrary since sloshers do not use traditional falloff mechanics.

- The group consists of only 1 projectile.

- The group starts spawning as soon as the lifting animation ends.

- The  projectile spawns with an initial speed of 1.4105 units per frame while grounded, and 1.38975 units per frame while airborne. It flies straight at this speed for 8 frames.
After this, the velocity is set to 10.0 units per frame if it is not already below this number, and decreases by 10% every frame, including the first frame in which it stops flying straight. Once the shot velocity decreases below a certain threshold, it will begin to be slowed more and fall faster.

- The projectile deals 55 damage.
The damage is not reduced by the projectile falling.

- The  projectile spawns with an initial collision radius of 0.04 units for players and 0.1 units for the stage. Over the course of 5 frames, the collision radius for players changes to 0.4 units, and over the course of 4 frames, the collision radius for the stage changes to 0.25 units.

The Custom Explosher is built with custom-tooled parts to create a new take on the original! It's basically the same Explosher you know and love, but this one comes with the Splash Wall sub to keep enemies at bay in close combat. And if your opponents push the issue, simply retort in the form of a devastating Triple Splashdown! I recommend this set to anyone with a customer-first approach. Go to your "clients" where they live, and deliver the hard sell!
